'''Charlton Heston''' (October 4, 1923 - April 5, 2008) was an acclaimed American actor famous for playing the title role in Ben Hur, winning the Academy Award for Best Actor, The Ten Commandments, which earned him a Golden Globe Award nomination and Planet of the Apes.  He appeared in over 100 films during a sixty year career.  Charlton also served five years as president of the National Rifle Association (1998 - 2003).  Charlton also held Q clearance as narrator of instructional films related to nuclear weapons.  (Q clearance is for Top Secret defence aspects).

Charlton was married to Lydia Marie Clark-Heston from 1944 to his death in 2008.  Charlton Heston plays himself in ''[[The One With Joey's Dirty Day]].''
